shapes.name: union
shapes.docs: Returns the union of two shapes

shapes.name: intersection
shapes.docs: Returns the intersection of two shapes

shapes.name: inverse
shapes.docs: Returns a shape that's the inverse of the input shape

shapes.name: difference
shapes.docs: Subtracts the second shape from the first

shapes.name: offset
shapes.docs:
Expand or contract a given shape by an offset
Positive offsets expand the shape; negative offsets shrink it

shapes.name: clearance
shapes.docs: Expands shape b by the given offset then subtracts it from shape a

shapes.name: shell
shapes.docs: Returns a shell of a shape with the given offset

shapes.name: blend_expt
shapes.docs: Blends two shapes by the given amount using exponents

shapes.name: blend_expt_unit
shapes.docs:
Blends two shapes by the given amount using exponents,
with the blend term adjusted to produce results approximately
resembling blend_rough for values between 0 and 1.

shapes.name: blend_rough
shapes.docs:
Blends two shapes by the given amount, using a fast-but-rough
CSG approximation that may not preserve gradients

shapes.name: blend_difference
shapes.docs:
Blends the subtraction of b, with optional offset o,
from a, with smoothness m

shapes.name: morph
shapes.docs:
Morphs between two shapes.
m = 0 produces a, m = 1 produces b

shapes.name: loft
shapes.docs:
Produces a blended loft between a (at zmin) and b (at zmax)
a and b should be 2D shapes (i.e. invariant along the z axis)

shapes.name: loft_between
shapes.docs:
Produces a blended loft between a (at lower.z) and b (at upper.z),
with XY coordinates remapped to slide between lower.xy and upper.xy.
a and b should be 2D shapes (i.e. invariant along the z axis)

shapes.name: circle
shapes.docs: A 2D circle with the given radius and optional center

shapes.name: ring
shapes.docs: A 2D ring with the given outer/inner radii and optional center

shapes.name: polygon
shapes.docs: A polygon with center-to-vertex distance r and n sides

shapes.name: rectangle
shapes.docs: A rectangle with the given bounding corners

shapes.name: rounded_rectangle
shapes.docs: A rectangle with rounded corners

shapes.name: rectangle_exact
shapes.docs: A rectangle from an exact distance field

shapes.name: rectangle_centered_exact
shapes.docs: An exact-field rectangle at the (optional) center

shapes.name: triangle
shapes.docs: A 2D triangle

shapes.name: box_mitered
shapes.docs: A box with the given bounds, which will stay creased if offset

shapes.name: box_mitered_centered
shapes.docs:
A box with the given size and (optional) center, with edges that
will stay sharp if offset.

shapes.name: box_exact_centered
shapes.docs:
A box with the given size, centered around the given point,
with a Euclidean distance metric

shapes.name: box_exact
shapes.docs: A box with the given bounds with a Euclidean distance metric

shapes.name: rounded_box
shapes.docs: Rounded box with the given bounds and radius (as a 0-1 fraction)

shapes.name: sphere
shapes.docs: A sphere with the given radius and (optional) center

shapes.name: half_space
shapes.docs:
A plane which divides the world into inside and outside, defined by its
normal and a single point on the plane

shapes.name: cylinder_z
shapes.docs:
A cylinder with the given radius and height, extruded from the
(optional) base position.

shapes.name: cone_ang_z
shapes.docs: A cone defined by its slope angle, height, and (optional) base location

shapes.name: cone_z
shapes.docs: A cone defined by its radius, height, and (optional) base location

shapes.name: pyramid_z
shapes.docs: A pyramid defined by its base rectangle, lower Z value, and height

shapes.name: torus_z
shapes.docs: A torus with the given outer radius, inner radius, and (optional) center

shapes.name: gyroid
shapes.docs: A volume-filling gyroid with the given periods and thickness

shapes.name: emptiness
shapes.docs: A value which is empty everywhere

shapes.name: array_x
shapes.docs: Iterates a part in a 1D array

shapes.name: array_xy
shapes.docs: Iterates a part in a 2D array

shapes.name: array_xyz
shapes.docs: Iterates a part in a 3D array

shapes.name: array_polar_z
shapes.docs: Iterates a shape about an optional center position

shapes.name: extrude_z
shapes.docs: Extrudes a 2D shape between zmin and zmax

shapes.name: move
shapes.docs: Moves the given shape in 2D or 3D space

shapes.name: reflect_x
shapes.docs: Reflects a shape about the x origin or an optional offset

shapes.name: reflect_y
shapes.docs: Reflects a shape about the y origin or an optional offset

shapes.name: reflect_z
shapes.docs: Reflects a shape about the z origin or an optional offset

shapes.name: reflect_xy
shapes.docs: Reflects a shape about the plane X=Y

shapes.name: reflect_yz
shapes.docs: Reflects a shape about the plane Y=Z

shapes.name: reflect_xz
shapes.docs: Reflects a shape about the plane X=Z

shapes.name: symmetric_x
shapes.docs:
Clips the given shape at the x origin, then duplicates the remaining
shape reflected on the other side of the origin

shapes.name: symmetric_y
shapes.docs:
Clips the given shape at the y origin, then duplicates the remaining
shape reflected on the other side of the origin

shapes.name: symmetric_z
shapes.docs:
Clips the given shape at the z origin, then duplicates the remaining
shape reflected on the other side of the origin

shapes.name: scale_x
shapes.docs: Scales a shape by sx on the x axis about 0 or an optional offset

shapes.name: scale_y
shapes.docs: Scales a shape by sx on the x axis about 0 or an optional offset

shapes.name: scale_z
shapes.docs: Scales a shape by sx on the x axis about 0 or an optional offset

shapes.name: scale_xyz
shapes.docs: Scales a shape on all three axes, about 0 or an optional offset

shapes.name: rotate_x
shapes.docs:
Rotate the given shape by an angle in radians
The center of rotation is [0 0 0] or specified by the optional argument

shapes.name: rotate_y
shapes.docs:
Rotate the given shape by an angle in radians
The center of rotation is [0 0 0] or specified by the optional argument

shapes.name: rotate_z
shapes.docs:
Rotate the given shape by an angle in radians
The center of rotation is [0 0 0] or specified by the optional argument

shapes.name: taper_x_y
shapes.docs:
Tapers a shape along the x axis as a function of y
width = base-scale at base
width = scale at base + [0 h]

shapes.name: taper_xy_z
shapes.docs:
Tapers a shape in the xy plane as a function of z
width = base-scale at base
width = scale at base + [0 0 height]

shapes.name: shear_x_y
shapes.docs:
Shears a shape on the x axis as a function of y
offset = base-offset at base.y
offset = offset = base.y + h

shapes.name: repel
shapes.docs:
Repels the shape away from a point based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: repel_x
shapes.docs:
Repels the shape away from a YZ plane based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: repel_y
shapes.docs:
Repels the shape away from a XZ plane based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: repel_z
shapes.docs:
Repels the shape away from a XY plane based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: repel_xy
shapes.docs:
Repels the shape away from line parallel to the Z axis,
with a particular radius and optional exaggeration

shapes.name: repel_yz
shapes.docs:
Repels the shape away from line parallel to the X axis,
with a particular radius and optional exaggeration

shapes.name: repel_xz
shapes.docs:
Repels the shape away from line parallel to the Y axis,
with a particular radius and optional exaggeration

shapes.name: attract
shapes.docs:
Attracts the shape away from a point based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: attract_x
shapes.docs:
Attracts the shape away from a YZ plane based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: attract_y
shapes.docs:
Attracts the shape away from a XZ plane based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: attract_z
shapes.docs:
Attracts the shape away from a XY plane based upon a radius r,
with optional exaggeration

shapes.name: attract_xy
shapes.docs:
Attracts the shape away from line parallel to the Z axis,
with a particular radius and optional exaggeration

shapes.name: attract_yz
shapes.docs:
Attracts the shape away from line parallel to the X axis,
with a particular radius and optional exaggeration

shapes.name: attract_xz
shapes.docs:
Attracts the shape away from line parallel to the Y axis,
with a particular radius and optional exaggeration

shapes.name: revolve_y
shapes.docs:
Revolves a 2D (XY) shape about a line parallel to the Y axis with the
given x value

shapes.name: twirl_x
shapes.docs: Twirls the shape in the x axis about the (optional) center point

shapes.name: twirl_axis_x
shapes.docs:
Twirls the shape in the x axis about the line extending from the
(optional) center point

shapes.name: twirl_y
shapes.docs: Twirls the shape in the y axis about the (optional) center point

shapes.name: twirl_axis_y
shapes.docs:
Twirls the shape in the y axis about the line extending from the
(optional) center point

shapes.name: twirl_z
shapes.docs: Twirls the shape in the z axis about the (optional) center point

shapes.name: twirl_axis_z
shapes.docs:
Twirls the shape in the z axis about the line extending from the
(optional) center point

shapes.name: text
shapes.docs:
Returns the given text, rendered in a custom f-rep font
(with a character height of 1)
